questions.quote: Going to Houston. It's a publisher's convention.  Can I have my sports section?
Excuse me. I'm sorry to make you do this, but I got stuck in the aisle and the flight attendant wouldn't let me get through. There's no way to get around that cart...
The city's a toilet. When's the last time you saw my little Adam?
Hello… yeah… yes it is… really… ah, ah… Could you hold on a second?  Hey listen to this, some woman found an electronic organizer, my name was in it, she wants me to help her track down the owner.
What? What? Who? Me-me-me? I made an impression? What impression?
Okay, he open-lips me, he dreams about me, we have an olive project...that's it, I'm asking this guy out.  Um, you know Greg, I...
Ach, I never knew what the hell I was peddling with those stupid cartoons and that paper book, anyway.
Hey. Hey, this is for you.  It's from.. uh, Susan's roommate, Sally.
...so I said to him: Arthur, Artie come on, why does the salesman have to die? Change the title; The life of a salesman. That's what people want to see.
I said preferably cashmere, for warmth. So in front of the whole party, he says, 'No. I don't want you stretching out the neck hole.'
